list.desc: Check supported gestures by mode, and click an item to view details.

detail.title: Action Details
detail.selectHint: Select an action on the left to see detailed instructions.

caution.title: Cautions
items: Recognition accuracy decreases in low light.
Keep your hands within the camera frame.
Perform motions slowly and with larger movements.
For combo gestures, keep them held simultaneously to be recognized.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Face your palm toward the camera
Move slowly around the center of the frame
tips: Moving your whole arm smoothly is more stable.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the cursor may stop.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index finger firmly
Hold longer to drag
tips: Don’t move too fast while dragging.
pitfalls: If the pinch is weak, clicks may be missed.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle finger to make a V
tips: A wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap, recognition may become unstable.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Hold a clear fist
Keep your hand near the center of the frame
tips: Recognition is more stable when fingers are fully folded.
pitfalls: A half-closed hand may be misrecognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle finger to make a V
tips: Keep the V angle wide.
pitfalls: If the angle is too narrow, it may be misrecognized as PINCH.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Keep your palm open
tips: Don’t place your hand too close to the camera.
pitfalls: If fingers bend, recognition may become unstable.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index finger firmly
tips: Hold the pinch for at least 0.2 seconds.
pitfalls: If you release too quickly, it may not be recognized.

gestures.name: PINCH + FIST
howTo: Make a fist while keeping PINCH held
tips: Both gestures must be held at the same time.
pitfalls: If done sequentially, it may be recognized as a single gesture.

gestures.name: PINCH + OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm while keeping PINCH held
tips: Keep your hand shape large and clear.
pitfalls: If fingers fold, only PINCH may be recognized.

gestures.name: PINCH + PINCH
howTo: Hold the PINCH state firmly
tips: Make the pinch clearly with stronger contact.
pitfalls: If weak, it may be handled as a single PINCH.

gestures.name: PINCH + V
howTo: Make a V gesture while keeping PINCH held
tips: Keep the V angle wide.
pitfalls: If timing is off, it may be recognized as directional input.

gestures.name: LEFT FIST + RIGHT OPEN_PALM
gestures.trigger: Hold left-hand FIST + move right-hand OPEN_PALM
howTo: Keep your left hand in a fist (FIST) continuously
Open your right hand (OPEN_PALM) and move it slowly like moving a cursor
Keep both hands within the camera frame
tips: Keep the left FIST firmly to stabilize right-hand movement recognition.
Move your whole arm smoothly rather than just your wrist.
pitfalls: If the left FIST releases, cursor movement may stop or disengage.
If either hand leaves the frame, recognition may be canceled.

gestures.name: LEFT FIST + RIGHT PINCH
howTo: Keep your left hand in a fist (FIST)
Pinch your right thumb and index briefly and clearly (PINCH)
After clicking, relax your hand naturally
tips: A short, clear pinch works best for clicks.
Make sure fingertip contact is obvious on the right-hand pinch.
pitfalls: If the left FIST releases, clicks may be missed.
If PINCH is weak or released too quickly, it may not be recognized.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Hold a clear fist
Recognized when held for 0.3s or more
tips: More stable when fingers are fully folded.
pitfalls: A half-closed hand may be misrecognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index finger firmly
PINCH over the selected key
tips: Keep the pinch short and clear
pitfalls: If the pinch is weak, input may be missed.

gestures.name: PINCH
gestures.action: PINCH down: pen down / Release: pen up
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index finger firmly
Move your hand while pinching to draw lines
Release to stop drawing
tips: Keeping pinch strength consistent helps stabilize lines.
Moving too fast may break the line.
pitfalls: A weak pinch may be mistaken for click or move.
Check the DRAW mode indicator to avoid confusing it with mouse drag.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm facing the camera
Move slowly around the center of the frame
tips: Moving your whole arm smoothly helps stability.
If lines jitter, adjust sensitivity/smoothing settings.
pitfalls: If fingers bend, it may be recognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: V + V
howTo: Keep both hands within the camera frame
Make V shapes with both hands (index + middle fingers spread)
Hold briefly (about 0.3–0.5s)
tips: Both hands must be recognized simultaneously.
A wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If only one hand is recognized, it may not start.
If fingers overlap, it may be misrecognized as PINCH.

gestures.name: V + V
howTo: Keep both hands within the camera frame
Make V shapes with both hands (index + middle fingers spread)
Hold briefly (about 0.3–0.5s)
tips: Both hands must be recognized to open the mode map.
pitfalls: Because it shares the same gesture as 'Start motion', behavior may depend on app state (READY/LIVE, etc.).

gestures.name: FIST + FIST
howTo: Make fists with both hands and hold
Keep both hands within the camera frame
Hold briefly (about 0.3–0.5s)
tips: Make firm fists with both hands to prevent accidental triggers.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, stop may be missed.
If either hand leaves the frame, recognition may be canceled.

gestures.name: FIST (Hold)
gestures.action: Toggle lock for all gesture inputs
howTo: Hold a fist (FIST) for a certain duration
Gestures are not recognized while locked
tips: Useful for preventing unintended inputs.
Consider showing a LOCKED badge in the UI while locked.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, lock may not engage.
If misfires are frequent, increase the hold duration (e.g., 1.0s).

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM + OPEN_PALM
howTo: Keep both hands within the camera frame
Open both palms facing the camera
tips: It won’t work if only one hand is recognized.
pitfalls: If hands leave the frame, recognition may be canceled.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Move with your palm open
tips: Used to select links or buttons during PPT.
pitfalls: Moving too fast can cause cursor jumps.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Do a short, clear PINCH
tips: Prefer short motions.
pitfalls: Holding too long may be misrecognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Make a fist with the cursor hand
tips: In PPT mode, FIST is dedicated to slides.
pitfalls: If too short, it may not be recognized.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle finger to make a V
tips: Keep the V angle wide.
pitfalls: If the angle is too narrow, it may be misrecognized as PINCH.

gestures.name: FIST + FIST (Hold)
howTo: Hold both hands as fists
tips: Hold longer to prevent accidental triggers.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, it may not exit.

gestures.name: PINCH + PINCH (Hold)
howTo: Hold PINCH with both hands
tips: Useful for switching between PPT and a browser.
pitfalls: If too short, it may be recognized as a single click.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm facing the camera
Move slowly around the center of the frame
tips: Moving your whole arm smoothly stabilizes the cursor.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the cursor may stop.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch your thumb and index briefly and clearly (PINCH)
tips: A quick pinch-and-release reduces missed clicks.
pitfalls: If the pinch is weak, clicks may be missed.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle finger to make a V
tips: A wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap, recognition may become unstable.

gestures.name: PINCH + STRETCH
howTo: Start with a PINCH (thumb + index), then
Keep the pinch held and 'stretch' your fingers/hand to drag
tips: Keep PINCH held during drag.
pitfalls: If PINCH releases, the drag may end.

gestures.name: V (Hold)
howTo: Make a V gesture with one hand, then
Hold it for a certain duration (like a long-press)
tips: Keeping a wide V angle improves stability.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, it may be treated as a normal V action.

gestures.name: V (Hold)
howTo: Make a V gesture with one hand, then
Hold it for a certain duration (like a long-press)
tips: Depending on the current state (shown/hidden), the keyboard may toggle.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, it may be treated as a normal V action.
